thread.text: It may not be your fault, but it is your problem.

replies.text: If you're anything like me, not changing for the rest of your life sounds like the ultimate hell.
Identity is just internal culture.

There are seasons of learning and seasons of earning. 

Make sure you know which one you‚Äôre in.
Money can't buy happiness but it can help you avoid pain.

"Am I overstepping by being here?"

Of course when you say it like that it's going to be a yes.

Try this instead.

If you want to be the best, prepare to be alone. Because there can only be one.

It took me a long time to realize the difference between being lonely and being alone.

Alone is a description of physical circumstance.

Loneliness is an unmet expectation.
A lot of people are seeking out alternative education sources to make money.

The best thing I ever did was not listen to other people‚Äôs opinions about my life.

They don‚Äôt want the best version of you. 

They want the version of you who best serves them.

I just made the largest investment of my life into Skool.com ‚Äî a platform with millions of users that makes starting your own online business simple, easy, and fun. 

I‚Äôve been looking for an opportunity to make starting a business accessible to EVERYONE. And after four years‚Ä¶I finally found it. Skool is that opportunity.

To give you an idea, users are joining Skool communities so fast that host payouts are growing by 62%...PER. MONTH. (Not a typo).

‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è

If that sounds interesting‚Ä¶we‚Äôve got something big coming. It involves business. Competition. Money. Prizes. And most importantly, you. It‚Äôs like nothing you‚Äôve ever seen before. You‚Äôre gonna love it. More Details to follow‚Ä¶stay tuned. 

Skool üöÄüåô

You‚Äôre not afraid of failing. 

You‚Äôre afraid of what other people will think of you if you fail.

But if you‚Äôre afraid of that, imagine what they think of you when you aren‚Äôt even trying.

Oh yea, they aren‚Äôt.
Wanting things fast doesn‚Äôt make them happen faster, it means you only go after smaller goals.
Poor people stay poor because they‚Äôre afraid of other poor people judging them for trying to get rich.

Monday Reminder:

You learn more by doing than you do by reading, planning, or talking about doing.

The only thing more expensive than a good lawyer is a bad one.

The only thing more expensive than a good accountant is a bad one.

The only thing more expensive than smart employees are dumb ones.

Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.

Just because it‚Äôs a good price, doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs a good deal.

Friendly reminder that it‚Äôs okay to work on weekends.

You‚Äôd be amazed how much faster you get to your goals when you don‚Äôt go backwards 104 days per year.

Contrary to what the mediocre masses will tell you - weekends can also be for work.

They‚Äôre right‚Ä¶you can work smart, not hard to make money. 

But you gotta work hard to get smart.

No way around it. The work needs doing.
If you let other people think for you, you‚Äôll get what they want for you.
If it‚Äôs not going to matter in 500 million years, it shouldn‚Äôt matter for 5 seconds.
A lot of poor people stay poor because they‚Äôre too cheap to get rich.

My entrepreneurial journey can be summarized as periods of:

Uncertainty
Ignorance
Suffering

Punctuated by a few material wins that pale in comparison to the effort that went into them, leaving you with a feeling of emptiness.

But besides that - lots of fun.

Recommend.
Wives and husbands are a dime a dozen but a true partner is worth their weight in gold.
The price of ignorance is the difference between where you are and where you wanna be.
The difference between optimism and delusion is reality.
